# Warm up   {#foreword}

## A small undergraduate course on Probability theory in a [dual curriculum](http://master.math.univ-paris-diderot.fr/annee/m1-mi/)


This _Probability_ course is a core part of [`Master Mathématique-Informatique Sciences des Données`](http://master.math.univ-paris-diderot.fr/annee/m1-mi/), a dual curriculum that delivers training in Mathematics and Computer Science at [Université de Paris](http://u-paris.fr).


```{r, echo=FALSE, fig.align='right', eval=knitr::is_html_output()}
knitr::include_url("http://master.math.univ-paris-diderot.fr/annee/m1-mi/", height = '300px')
```



The _Probability_ course is related to many other courses from the same
curriculum.

Relevant courses from the first semester are:

1. [Théorie de l'information](http://master.math.univ-paris-diderot.fr/modules/m1mi-theorie-information/)
1. [Algorithmique](http://master.math.univ-paris-diderot.fr/modules/m1info-algo/)
1. [Complexité](http://master.math.univ-paris-diderot.fr/modules/m1math-s1-algo/)

Relevant courses from second semester and second year are:

1. [Statistique](http://master.math.univ-paris-diderot.fr/modules/m1math-s2-stat-fonda/)
2. [Analyse de données](http://master.math.univ-paris-diderot.fr/modules/m1mi-s2-ana-donnees)
3. [Algorithmique avancée](http://master.math.univ-paris-diderot.fr/modules/m1info-algo-avancee/)
4. [Technologie Big Data](http://master.math.univ-paris-diderot.fr/modules/m1mi-big-data/)
3. [Machine learning](http://master.math.univ-paris-diderot.fr/modules/m2mo-ml/)
1. [Deep learning](http://master.math.univ-paris-diderot.fr/modules/m2mo-deepl/)
2. [Renforcement](http://master.math.univ-paris-diderot.fr/modules/m2mo-renforcement/)
3. [Données massives](http://master.math.univ-paris-diderot.fr/modules/m2mo-mmd/)

This list is not exhaustive.

This course is geared towards data science applications. We borrow examples
and applications of probability theory from statistics, computer science and
big data engineering. As we have a limited amount of time,
we sweep a lot of dust under the carpet. We take for granted
key results from integration and measure theory. Nevertheless, we build on rigorous
definitions, state and invoke theorems in a consistent way.


- `r fontawesome::fa("link")` [Homepage of the course](stephane-v-boucheron.fr/courses/probability).
- `r fontawesome::fa("link")` [Moodle page of the course](https://moodle.u-paris.fr/mod/folder/view.php?id=81541).

## Prerequisites

This course builds on two Licence-level courses:

- [Probabilités Licence 3](http://licence.math.univ-paris-diderot.fr/modules/l3-maths-mfa-maths-s5-probas/)
- [Intégration](http://licence.math.univ-paris-diderot.fr/modules/l3-maths-mfa-maths-s6-Integration/)

`r fontawesome::fa("link")` __Notebooks__

Throughout the course, we illustrate problems and concepts
using `Python` notebooks. You should be able to explore the notebooks
by yourself. My current configuration relies on:

- [`Python`](https://www.python.org) (3.8.6, use [`pyenv`](), [`virtualenv`]())
  - `Numpy`  for nice numerical arrays and random generation
  - `Scipy`  with module `stats` for a zoo of probability distributions
  - `Pandas`  for data analysis
  - `Networkx` to play with random graphs
  - `igraph` to play with random graphs (again)
  - `Matplotlib`  for graphics
  - `plotly` for better graphics
  - `Jupyter`  for its interactive kernels, an easy path to literate programming, and technical reporting
  - `Jupytext`
  - `Dask`
- I use [`Atom`](https://atom.io) + plugin [`Hydrogen`](https://atom.io/packages/hydrogen) as a `Python`  IDE


The notebooks are available at the following URLs:

1. [Hashing and random functions](http://stephane-v-boucheron.fr/post/2019-09-02-idealizedhashing/)
